result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice Lavelle Hatchett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig in court for the State of Wisconsin. Bench warrant ordered. Cash bond of $500 set. Reviewable by Branch 1 only. RECALLED 11:11 AM Defendant Maurice Lavelle Hatchett in court.  Attorney Shanna Sanders in court for Maurice Lavelle Hatchett.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant vacated. Defendant pleads no contest to count 2. Court finds defendant guilty of count 2. Court orders 7 days jail and costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit 7 days. Count 1 dismissed and read in.
